positions.title: Principal AI Researcher & Consultant
positions.description:
â€¢ Deeper focus on GenAI/LLM Multi-Agent Systems (MAS)
 - organizing company R&D Task Forces
 - blog articles, white papers, webinars
 - building demo apps deployed on company-internal platform (terraform, AWS, GitLab) for sales pitches and marketing
 - further technologies (on top of tech in previous position): AutoGen, CrewAI, LangGraph, LangSmith, GPTs, Azure OpenAI Studio, Llama3, Qdrant
â€¢ Public sector work on job skill extraction from job offers and CVs via classic NLP and LLMs
- developed processing pipeline for Web UI in production (tens of thousands requests/day, <1s/document)
- tools/technologies: Named Entity Recognition (NER), Named Entity Linking (NEL), spaCy, huggingface, transformer Modelle, MLFlow, hnsw, MongoDB, PostgresSQL, Bitbucket, Docker, pytest, poetry, Factory Design Patterns, pre-commit hooks, GDPR-compliant anonymization
â€¢ Sales pitches
â€¢ Interviewing

positions.title: Senior Data Science Consultant
positions.description:
â€¢ Data Science and AI consulting
â€¢ Webinars, seminars, workshops and hackathons about Data Science, Generative Ai (GenAI) and Prompt Engineering 
â€¢ Public sector and automotive industry
â€¢ Development of LLM chatbots on custom data:
 - Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) via semantic search on Vector Databases (ChromaDB, Weaviate)
 - Use of various open and closed source LLMs and providers (OpenAI GPT-3.5, Meta Llama2, Databricks Dolly, NVIDIA Megatron, Aleph Alpha Luminous) 
 - LLM Finetuning, Prompt Engineering, HuggingFace, LangChain
â€¢ Development of AI image generator apps
 - comic generator app (streamlit, GPT-3.5, Stable Diffusion)
â€¢ classic NLP:
 - Text classification, NER, SpaCy
â€¢ Data anonymization and encryption for GDPR compliance
â€¢ Streaming/telematics data analysis

positions.title: PhD in Computational Neuroscience & Vision Data Science
positions.description:
â€¢ Combined vision neuroscience & data science | machine learning to dynamically predict neural activity to natural movie stimuli and study feedback loops and system robustness, with the goal to eventually emulate vision with a Deep Neural Network (DNNs) | Artificial Intelligence (AI)
â€¢ 6 years of experience building Python-based SQL database pipelines with version control, code review, unit testing, performance optimization, remote access and integration with multiple collaborative lab code repositories 
â€¢ Custom-built, grid-search-optimized and cross-validated models, and classified neurons via regression, PCA, ICA, SVD, clustering and matrix factorization 
â€¢ Performed standard parametric and non-parametric, as well as custom-made bootstrapped statistical tests
â€¢ Planned and executed complex long term project collaboration across three labs in Munich and TÃ¼bingen
â€¢ Formulated scientific questions, developed, planned and conducted experiments, and collected, cleaned, analyzed and visualised data
â€¢ Self-organized teamwork with fellow students for biweekly report deadlines to supervisors, using various project, task and time management tools for effective and adaptive schedules and priorities
â€¢ Mentored and taught several MSc students, raised morale and motivation in the face of failures and got all of them onto publications
â€¢ Collaborated with colleagues and contributed to their published projects
â€¢ Scouted Masterâ€™s and PhD recruits to get best people into the team
â€¢Â Set up a lab wiki to iteratively consolidate our SOPs
â€¢Â Established a lab meeting agenda to capture task responsibilities, objectives and key results
â€¢ Constructed a lab website to increase public outreach
â€¢ Increased awareness of people management (regular student talks and lab survey to address potential issues)
â€¢ Published in multiple peer-reviewed journals, gave talks and poster presentations at conferences


Joint supervisors: Prof. Busse (LMU), Prof. Berens (U TÃ¼bingen) and Prof. Euler (U TÃ¼bingen)

volunteerExperiences.role: Organizing committee member for Talking Science events
volunteerExperiences.description:
Talking Science is a unique opportunity to meet and talk about neuroscience with a leading researcher in an informal atmosphere - a two-day program for the MSc and PhD students of LMU, TUM, and the MPIs.
https://www.talking-science.de/
volunteerExperiences.companyName: Graduate School of Systemic Neurosciences - LMU Munich

volunteerExperiences.role: Student Representative for Oxford University Psychology undergraduates

allData.headline: Data Science & GenAI | Consultant | Computational Neuroscientist
allData.summary:
I am a data science | AI researcher and consultant focusing on GenAI | LLM | NLP | RAG | Multi-Agent System (MAS) technologies. In my client and internal R&D projects, I build those systems (PoCs, demos, and in production), and give seminars and trainings about prompt engineering for ChatGPT, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, and other closed- and open-source models. Starting my life as a Northern German countryside boy from a non-academic background, my journey has taken many improbable paths*. There are still many things Iâ€™d like to do, but if none of them came true, that would also be okay. 

Some of my guiding principles:
â€¢ life and the universe have no intrinsic goal â€“ what we call purpose or meaningful are the things we value, and that's all that's needed        (to make their pursuit worthwhile and life beautiful)
â€¢ people first        (or the ultimate goal should be the flourishing of sentient beings)
â€¢ don't treat others like you wouldn't want to be treated (silver rule), treat others like you would like to be treated (golden), treat others like they would like to be treated (diamond)
â€¢ freedom, equality, and justice       (everyone should get a fair chance to flourish in their way)
â€¢ everything is transient        (and one primary cause for suffering is non-acceptance of this reality through craving and aversion)
â€¢ our selves are made up of multiple selves (recognition of this fact allows us to integrate our conflicting parts)
â€¢ judge an action by its consequences in context (don't get stuck on principles)
â€¢ done is better than perfect        (good enough is better than not done)

Making the world a better place is a noble but difficult goal. In my view, Effective Altruism (EA) is one of the better ways to care about global priority topics and the long-term future before we run out of time to find infinity.

My hobbies past and present include fine arts, photography, guitar, reading, juggling, jogging, linguistics, Ultimate Frisbee, swimming, cycling, triathlons, yoga, Lindy Hop dancing, and Vipassana meditation. 

If you are curious or inspired to connect, feel free to reach out and we can explore things together!

*Also including stints as a volunteer for people with special needs in Aberdeen, Scotland, and as a journalist in LomÃ©, Togo.
